User Story: As a product team, we want a published governance charter so that decision rights and responsibilities are clear.
Acceptance Criteria: Charter published; RACI agreed; decision rights documented.

User Story: As a service owner, we want an intake and triage workflow so that all work is tracked and prioritised consistently.
Acceptance Criteria: Intake channels defined; triage categories defined; backlog updated weekly.

User Story: As a product manager, we want backlog scoring so that prioritisation is transparent and repeatable.
Acceptance Criteria: Value/Risk/Effort scoring used on all new items; priority bands defined.

User Story: As a user, I want a clear Teams/Site naming standard so that content is searchable and manageable.
Acceptance Criteria: Naming format published; examples provided; provisioning follows naming rules.

User Story: As an owner, I want lifecycle rules so that Teams/Sites have clear ownership and review cadence.
Acceptance Criteria: Owners required; 6-month reviews defined; archive rules defined.

User Story: As a security stakeholder, I want limited-by-default guest access so that external collaboration is controlled.
Acceptance Criteria: Workflow documented; expiry policy defined; approvals recorded.

User Story: As an employee, I want sensitivity labels so that I can classify documents and apply appropriate protection.
Acceptance Criteria: Label taxonomy defined; labels visible in apps; guidance published.

User Story: As a compliance stakeholder, I want a DLP starter policy so that accidental leakage is reduced.
Acceptance Criteria: Pilot created; policy tips enabled; monitoring/reporting defined.

User Story: As a user, I want simple guidance so that I know when to use Teams vs SharePoint vs OneDrive safely.
Acceptance Criteria: One-page guide published; examples included; referenced in onboarding.

User Story: As support staff, we want an incident runbook so that incidents are handled consistently and quickly.
Acceptance Criteria: Runbook includes triage, escalation, comms, PIR; stored in repo.

User Story: As change coordinators, we want a change runbook so that governance changes are safe and reversible.
Acceptance Criteria: CAB-lite process defined; comms template; rollback plan required.

User Story: As a product team, we want KPI reporting so that adoption, incidents, and exceptions can be monitored.
Acceptance Criteria: KPI definitions agreed; monthly review cadence; first report produced.

User Story: As a security stakeholder, we want periodic guest access reviews so that guest sprawl is reduced.
Acceptance Criteria: Review cadence defined; owners notified; removals tracked.

User Story: As a product team, we want owners reviewed every 6 months so that responsibilities remain current.
Acceptance Criteria: Owner review process documented; reminders scheduled; exceptions tracked.

User Story: As a product team, we want a tuning plan so that DLP false positives are reduced.
Acceptance Criteria: Weekly review; documented adjustments; measured reduction in noise.

User Story: As a product team, we want an exception process so that justified deviations are controlled and time-bound.
Acceptance Criteria: Exception template; approval path; expiry date required.

User Story: As an admin team, we want provisioning templates so that Teams/Sites are created consistently.
Acceptance Criteria: Template documented; includes naming, owners, baseline settings.

User Story: As an owner, I want short training so that I understand guest access, labels, and reviews.
Acceptance Criteria: 30-min module; checklist; completion tracked.

User Story: As security, we want monitoring of external sharing events so that risky behaviour is detected.
Acceptance Criteria: Key events defined; reporting cadence; escalation triggers.

User Story: As leadership, we want a dashboard so that governance KPIs are visible at a glance.
Acceptance Criteria: Metrics defined; dashboard built; reviewed quarterly.
